name: pyroscope-profiler
description: Continuous profiling visualization with inline performance metrics and heat maps

viewsWelcome.contents:
No profile loaded.
[Load Profile from File](command:pyroscope.loadProfile)
[Query Pyroscope Server](command:pyroscope.queryServer)

[Configure Server Settings](command:pyroscope.configureServer)

pyroscope.heatmap.enabled.description: Enable heat map visualization of performance bottlenecks

pyroscope.inlineMetrics.enabled.description: Show inline performance metrics next to code lines

pyroscope.heatmap.colorScheme.description: Color scheme for heat map visualization

pyroscope.heatmap.intensity.description: Background color intensity for heat map (0.1 = subtle, 1.0 = bold)

pyroscope.metrics.threshold.description: Minimum percentage threshold to display metrics (0-100)

pyroscope.metrics.showSelf.description: Show self time in inline metrics

pyroscope.metrics.showTotal.description: Show total/cumulative time in inline metrics

pyroscope.server.url.description: Pyroscope server URL (e.g., https://profiles-prod-001.grafana.net or http://localhost:4040)

pyroscope.server.username.description: Username for Pyroscope server authentication (Grafana Cloud stack user)

pyroscope.server.password.description: Password/API key for Pyroscope server authentication (Grafana Cloud API key)

pyroscope.server.serviceName.description: Service name for Pyroscope queries (required for querying server). Will be used to construct query: process_cpu:cpu:nanoseconds:cpu:nanoseconds{service_name="<value>"}

pyroscope.server.query.description: Pyroscope query string (profile type and label selectors). If not set, will be constructed from serviceName. Override this if you need a custom query format.

pyroscope.server.useConnectAPI.description: Use Connect API (returns pprof format) instead of legacy HTTP API

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
